name: InterimResult
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
InterimResult
description:
InterimResult

A streaming speech recognition result corresponding to a portion of the audio that is currently being processed.

See Project#stream and Stream#on_interim.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/speech"

speech = Google::Cloud::Speech.new

stream = speech.stream encoding: :linear16,
                       language: "en-US",
                       sample_rate: 16000

# register callback for when an interim result is returned
stream.on_interim do |final_results, interim_results|
  interim_result = interim_results.first
  puts interim_result.transcript # "how old is the Brooklyn Bridge"
  puts interim_result.confidence # 0.9826789498329163
  puts interim_result.stability # 0.8999
end

# Stream 5 seconds of audio from the microphone
# Actual implementation of microphone input varies by platform
5.times do
  stream.send MicrophoneInput.read(32000)
end

stream.stop

methods.name: transcript
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
InterimResult#transcript
methods.description: Transcript text representing the words that the user spoke.

methods.name: confidence
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
InterimResult#confidence
methods.description: The confidence estimate between 0.0 and 1.0. A higher number means the system is more confident that the recognition is correct. This field is typically provided only for the top hypothesis. A value of 0.0 is a sentinel value indicating confidence was not set.

methods.name: stability
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
InterimResult#stability
methods.description: An estimate of the probability that the recognizer will not change its guess about this interim result. Values range from 0.0 (completely unstable) to 1.0 (completely stable). Note that this is not the same as confidence, which estimates the probability that a recognition result is correct.

methods.name: alternatives
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
InterimResult#alternatives
methods.description: Additional recognition hypotheses (up to the value specified in max_alternatives).
